Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior, which has flaked away in places, bears traces of a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, which is also damaged, bears traces of a brown slip and remains of a number of lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394531) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394531)
